definition: simplified Chinese character, as opposed to traditional Chinese character 繁體字|繁体字[fan2 ti3 zi4]
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Did you study standard or simplified Characters?
sentences.chinese: 所学是正体字或简体字？

sentences.english: A summation of the kinds of differences found between traditional characters and their simplified versions.
sentences.chinese: 为繁体字和简体字之间的诸多不同之处作一综述。

sentences.english: We should have a mastery of the advantages and disadvantages of both complex Chinese characters and simplified Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 汉字繁体字和简体字，从不同的角度看，各有优缺点。

sentences.english: And they pride themselves in not using the simplified version.
sentences.chinese: 他们为自己没有使用简体字而感到自豪。

sentences.english: Simplified Chinese characters from Oracle to the evolutionary history of a continuous and verifiable.
sentences.chinese: 简体字来自于连续可证明的甲骨文的进化史。

sentences.english: The simplified characters are too rough to express the Artistic qualities of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 简体字过于粗糙无法表达汉字形意的美感。

definition: traditional Chinese character
traditional form of Chinese, as opposed to simplified form 簡體|简体[jian3 ti3]
standard form of a Chinese character/(Tw) traditional (i.e. unsimplified) characters
simplified Chinese character
simplified form of Chinese characters, as opposed to traditional form 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3]
Mandarin phonetic symbols (MPS), phonetic alphabet for Chinese used esp. in Taiwan, also known colloquially as Bopomofo (after the first four letters of the alphabet:ㄅㄆㄇㄈ)
to indicate the pronunciation of Chinese characters using Pinyin or Bopomofo etc/phonetic notation/(specifically) Bopomofo (abbr. for 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4])
everyday words
phonetic alphabet/alphabetic writing system
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
see 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4]
lit. Martian language/fig. Internet slang used to communicate secret messages that the general public or government can't understand
the common use romanization system introduced in Taiwan in 2003
katakana (Japanese script)
hiragana (Japanese script)
Cantonese romanization/Jyutping, one of the many Cantonese romanization systems
